extendedInfo.description: Your goal in Falling Water is to get water flowing from the faucet(s) into the cup(s) in each level.Tap the red dot to turn the flow of water on/off and draw on the screen with your finger to place concrete. Switch between drawing and erasing using the button in the top left corner of the screen. To clear the screen of all concrete press the button in the upper right corner.If your phone is fast enough, pressing the slower/faster button will speed up the water to make for less waiting. Also note that if you leave the level using either the Back or Home button you will lose your progress on that level. If you get tired of the main levels or just want to relax then try Free Style!Falling Water is similar to the game Falling Sand and both owe their logic to John Conwayâââs Game of Life (1970) the best known example of cellular automation. Falling Water was designed and programmed by Arthur Haugh.Got an idea for a level? Draw it out and e-mail it to us!If you like Mighty Wind's first game, support us by clicking the in-game ads.

reviews.title: Good game, needs work.
reviews.comment: I like the concept, but I l\'m not sure it works on some of the larger phones, simply because of scaling. Level 5\'s layout doesn\'t seem to work on my Galaxy S3, because the cap on the cup sort of intersects where the water should go, and prevents one pixel from filling, so I cannot win the level.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Two problems
reviews.comment: Force closes like every 2 mins. I filled the cup in level 5 but i couldn\'t pass. Please fix this!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: A fun game, but...
reviews.comment: this game started out ok, but now it \"force closes\" everytime I play.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good idea, bad implementation
reviews.comment: Decent idea but the levels are easy and boring. Waiting for minutes at a time for the water to fill up enough so it overflows into the containers on the upwards levels made me switch it off and uninstall.   Drawing often doesn\'t work and leaves gaps that need replacing, and it becomes frustrating.   To the developer and other downloaders: Take a look at \"Where\'s my Water\" for a good implementation of this idea. The developer also needs to take a look at good UI design and interaction too.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nope
reviews.comment: Can\'t draw a straight line. The lines disconnect or have gaps everytime. Can\'t zoom. Really clunky game
reviews.author: Ace Viking

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.comment: The game is not to great. On freestyle it automatically closes and i can\'t play the game
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crashes after level 9
reviews.comment: Won\'t let me finish the game to completion. Pretty annoying considering how short the game is. Other than that, clever idea. Maybe add more features, fix the water so it isn\'t constantly boiling? Or whatever makes it so animated. Let us increase water flow or tap size so we don\'t need to sit there for an hour.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pretty Nice
reviews.comment: Looks like the company\'s first game, and it ain\'t too shabby. Water goes around sink traps which is impossible in most falling sand games.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fun but has problems
reviews.comment: Level 5 will not pass, have tried multiple ways of filling cup, but always has a white \"bubble\" in the top center pixel. Please correct this.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Level 5 won\'t work.
reviews.comment: The cups fill, yet it will not pass the level. Rather annoying. Please fix.

reviews.comment: Buttons are tiny and unusable on my 720p screen. No zoom ability also cripples game. Would not recommend.

reviews.title: Haters
reviews.comment: As a fellow developer I see what you are doing there and think its cool. Players want the world, but can\'t deliver anything but complaints.

reviews.comment: A nice game. A few suggestions: ability to zoom, as its quite small and hard to be accurate, also the ability to undo the last line drawn.
